intro: Stachys iranica, commonly known as Persian betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Iran and Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, producing purple or violet blooms that attract pollinators. Stachys iranica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and calming properties.
